text: ==Qualification timeline== {|class="wikitable" width=600 |- ! Event !! Date !! Venue |- | Pan American Games Qualifier 1 || March 25 to March 30, 2011 || CumanáPanamerican Games Qualifier - Cumana, Venezuela - March 25-30 2011 results |- | Pan American Games Qualifier 2 || April 30 to May 6, 2011 || QuitoPanamerican Games Qualifier - Quito, Ecuador - May 1-6 2011 results |- | Pan American Games Qualifier 3 || July 3 to July 7, 2011 || Panama CityPanamerican Games Qualifier - Panama City, Panama - July 3-7 2011 results |} :1. Colombia was scheduled to host the third qualification tournament but had to withdraw when the money budgeted for the event had to be reassigned to flood relief. On May 15, Panama was confirmed to host the tournament. Earlier Dominican Republic and the Bahamas had put in bids. ==Qualification summary== ==Light flyweight (-49kg)== {|class = "wikitable" width=800 |- ! Event !! Vacancies !! Qualified |- | Host || align="center"|1 || Joselito VelázquezMéxico define selección de boxeo rumbo a los Panamericanos |- | Pan American Games Qualifier 1 || align="center"|4 || Juan Medina Anthony Ortiz Ceiber Avila Junior Zarate |- | Pan American Games Qualifier 2 || align="center"|3 || Carlos Quipo Yosvany Veitia David Jimenez |- | Pan American Games Qualifier 3 || align="center"|2 || Gilberto Pedroza Evier Hernandez |- ! colspan="1"|TOTAL !!10!! |} ==Flyweight (-52kg)== {|class = "wikitable" width=800 |- ! Event !! Vacancies !!
